definition: manner/style/panache
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns

sentences.english: The Little Princess Dress also comes with a matching cone style hat.
sentences.chinese: 小公主裙還帶有一個錐氣勢派頭匹配的飾品。

sentences.english: Masterful Scorpio should make a good mate for quiet spoken Cancer.
sentences.chinese: 主任派頭的天蠍會是寡言少語巨蟹的好伴侶。

sentences.english: He has the typical reportorial manner.
sentences.chinese: 他有一種典型的記者派頭。

sentences.english: Can't you see he just wants to play the aristocrat?
sentences.chinese: 你看不出他就是想扮出一副貴族派頭嗎？

to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
richly bedecked/dripping with gold and silver (idiom)
to tease/to poke fun at
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
lit. to order people by pointing the chin (idiom); to signal orders by facial gesture/arrogant and bossy
calm and composed (idiom)
pleasure seeking (idiom); life of dissipation
unscrupulous businessperson/profiteer/philistine
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
young and promising
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
